1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Can pornography be considered a form of art, has internet dating made Generation Y too superficial, and should the contraceptive pill be made freely available to high school students?

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: The panel discusses whether covering up is a sign you are a "prude", whether cats are better than dogs, and if new immigrants to Australia should be compulsorily enrolled in an English language school.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: Is it ever fair to judge a person by their job? Does bisexuality actually exist or it is just a "phase", and are you for or against genetically modified organisms?

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Should men make the first move, and should a first date end with a kiss? Are the police really looking out for the community's best interests?

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: The panel discusses if blood and organ donations should be made mandatory for healthy individuals, whether hate speech should be allowed under free speech, and if parents should have the right to genetically modify their child before it is born.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: When is the best time to meet your partner's parents, and what does it mean for your relationship? Is it OK for potential employers to research social media prior to an interview, and is it OK to sell hormones to pre-teens who identify themselves as the opposite sex?

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: The panel discusses if Generation Y is obsessed with getting "likes" and "followers" on social media, and whether naked Snapchats should be considered sexual harassment.

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: Generation Y has been raised with technology and social media, so how has this affected interpersonal relationships that don't involve technology? And can sex be used as a currency in a relationship?

9.title: Episode #2.9
9.plot: The panel discusses if Australians are politically naive, if Australia's social security system is contributing to a "welfare state", and how legalising cannabis would affect Australian society.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: Are you "old-fashioned" if you don't think naked selfies are a good idea, and is nudity becoming more acceptable in our society? Is it OK to breastfeed in public, and where did Western Sydney's bad reputation come from?

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: The panel asks if it's OK to invite an ex to your wedding, whether tattoos are acceptable or not, and if gay marriage should be legalised.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: How much is too much when it comes to a public display of affection? And should Australia accept asylum seekers arriving by boat?

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Does an age difference matter when it comes to relationships? Has technology ruined Gen Y? And should Australia have stricter drug laws?

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: The panel discusses if it's ever OK to break up with someone via text message, whether Gen Y doesn't care about "real" issues, and if this generation can achieve world peace.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: The panel discusses the big questions, like "is it OK to urinate in the shower or at the beach". They also debate whether Gen Y takes criticism well, and the thorny issue of abortion.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Is Gen Y lazy, do they want it all without having to work for it? And what exactly is the right age to have a child?

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Is chivalry dead? Does Generation Y follow trends like sheep, and is it OK to marry someone without having lived with them first?

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: The panel discuss how many are too many sexual partners, whether Gen Y is obsessed with reality television, and if Australians should be drug tested before receiving social benefits.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Can long distance relationships really work? Are members of Generation Y really disrespectful to elders and people in authority? And is capital punishment an effective deterrent?

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: The panel discusses whether gender equality is an issue for Generation Y, when to intervene during other people's public arguments, and whether the obesity epidemic is the fault of parents.

imdb.plot outline: Why Generation is a panel discussion series aimed at engaging the youth of Sydney. Each episode of the 10 part series is researched, produced and presented by students from the University of Western Sydney. With debate on issues ranging from politics to fashion, and weekly explorations into Y Generation stereotypes, the program has something to offer viewers from across the spectrum. Why Generation acts as a platform for UWS students to look at issues critically and to express their ideas in an always intelligent and often comical way. Whether or not you agree with the opinions, you will be enthralled as the panelists debate the issues fiercely and passionately, stirring controversy and challenging agendas. You might even find your family and friends carrying on the debate long after the program ends.
